pdf

Class PdfBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • pdf.PdfBox

  • public class PdfBox
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a method to create a temporary PDF file from a budget that can be downloaded or sent by email. This class uses the FileDAO data storage classes and the related with the Budget class
    Author:
    oscar

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  PdfBox.Cell
      This class represents a cell in a table with a set of attributes that are set in the constructor and the methods to retrieve these attributes

    • Constructor Detail

      • PdfBox

        private PdfBox(java.io.File file,
               Budget budget)
        Private constructor. Manages the whole construction of the PDF file, that stores in the file passed by the parameter. It will rewrite the file if it already exists
        Parameters:
        file - File where the PDF is stored.
        budget - The budget to show in the PDF.

    • Method Detail

      • createPdf

        public static java.io.File createPdf(Budget budget)
        The only one public method. Generates a PDF file in the temporary folder with the budgetID as the name. Rewrites the file if already exists. The PDF contains the information of the budget and its attachments. Returns null if there is a problem
        Parameters:
        budget - Budget to print in the PDF
        Returns:
        File that contains the PDF

      • initializeCursor

        private void initializeCursor()
        Calculates the position of the margins, sets the attributes about the page size and sets the cursorPosition at the top of a page

      • createPage

        private void createPage()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new page in the PDF, draws the header of the page and the page number at the bottom
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createDocument

        private void createDocument()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the document and imports the fonts that will be needed. The fonts should be stored in the Global folder
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • drawCover

        private void drawCover()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new page and draws the cover image as the background. Also writes the text in the cover
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • drawImage

        private void drawImage(org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.edit.PDPageContentStream stream,
                       java.io.File image,
                       float x,
                       float y,
                       float width,
                       float height)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Draws an image in the coordinates specified, streching the image to fill all the space
        Parameters:
        stream - The open PDPageContentStream to write
        image - Image file
        x - Coordinate of the left side of the image
        y - Coordinate of the top side of the image
        width - The width of the image
        height - The height of the image
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getLines

        private static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLines(float width,
                                                         java.lang.String text,
                                                         int fontSize,
                                                         org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont font)
        Breaks the text in lines to make long text to fit in a specified width
        Parameters:
        width - The maximum width of each line
        text - The text
        fontSize - The size of the font
        font - The font used to write the text
        Returns:
        A list of lines

      • encodeText

        protected static java.lang.String encodeText(java.lang.String text)
        Encodes the text before being written in the PDF replacing all characters with their codes to avoid illegible characters. If the character does not have a code or does not exist in the font, it will be replaced by a " ". This method must be called before writing text in the PDF
        Parameters:
        text - The text to write
        Returns:
        The text to write compatible with the PDF

      • drawParagraph

        private void drawParagraph(float x,
                           float y,
                           float width,
                           java.lang.String text,
                           int fontSize,
                           org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont font,
                           java.lang.String alignment,
                           org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.edit.PDPageContentStream out)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a text in the specified coordinates with the specified width. The text can be aligned to the Left, Right or Center
        Parameters:
        x - The coordinate of the left side
        y - The coordinate of the top side
        width - The maximum width of the text
        text - The text to write
        fontSize - The size of the font
        font - The font to use to write the text
        alignment - Left, Right or Center
        out - An open stream where the PDF is written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        text - The text to write
        fontSize - The size of the font
        font - The font to use to write the text

      • drawTitle

        private void drawTitle(java.lang.String text)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a title consisting of a line from marginLeft to the text of the title and the text, in color, below cursorPosition. Also moves cursorPosition to the bottom of the title, with vertical margins. The titles are used in each section header and in the budget summary
        Parameters:
        text - The text of the title
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTitleHeight

        private float getTitleHeight()
        Calculates the height used by the title and its margins without drawing it
        Returns:
        The height that would need

      • drawProduct

        private void drawProduct(SectionProduct product)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a product in the last page or in a new one if there is no enough space. Draws the product below cursorPosition, and sets it at the bottom of the product at the end. The product consists of a name, its description, a photo and a table with its reference, quantity and prices
        Parameters:
        product - The product to draw
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getProductHeight

        private float getProductHeight(SectionProduct product)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Measures the drawn of a product, without drawing it. The drawn consists of a name, its description, a photo and a table with its reference, quantity and prices
        Parameters:
        product - The product to measure its drawn
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • drawTable

        private float drawTable(float x,
                        float y,
                        float[] columnWidths,
                        float rowGap,
                        float columnGap,
                        PdfBox.Cell[][] cells)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a table from the coordinates specified with the widths introduced. If it does not fit in the current page, it will create a new page and continue drawing the table there. If it creates a new page, it will edit cursorPosition. columnWidths should be as long as each row in cells
        Parameters:
        x - The coordinate of the left side of the table
        y - The coordinate of the top of the table
        columnWidths - A list of the widths of each column
        rowGap - The white space between rows
        columnGap - The white space between columns
        cells - The matrix of cells to draw: Rows of cells
        Returns:
        The height of the table in the last page it is drawn
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getTableHeight

        protected static float getTableHeight(float[] columnWidths,
                                      float rowGap,
                                      PdfBox.Cell[][] cells)
        Calculates the height of a table that would be drawn with the sizes introduced. columnWidths should be as long as each row in cells
        Parameters:
        columnWidths - A list of the widths of each column
        rowGap - The white space between rows
        cells - The matrix of cells to draw: Rows of cells
        Returns:
        The height of the table that would be drawn

      • getTableWidth

        protected static float getTableWidth(float[] columnWidths,
                                     float columnGap)
        Calculates the width of a table that would be drawn with the widths introduced
        Parameters:
        columnWidths - A list of the widths of each column
        columnGap - The white space between columns
        Returns:
        The width of the table that would be drawn

      • getRowHeight

        protected static float getRowHeight(float[] widths,
                                    PdfBox.Cell[] cells)
        Calculates the height of a row of a table that would be drawn with the sizes introduced. columnWidths should be as long as the row of cells
        Parameters:
        widths - The widths of each column in the row
        cells - The cells of each column in the row
        Returns:
        The height of the highest cell in the row

      • drawCell

        private void drawCell(float x,
                      float y,
                      float width,
                      float height,
                      PdfBox.Cell cell,
                      org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.edit.PDPageContentStream out)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a cell from the coordinates specified with the sizes introduced
        Parameters:

        y - The coordinate of the top of the cell
        width - The width of the cell rectangle
        height - The height of the cell rectangle
        cell - The cell data
        out - An open stream where the PDF is written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getCellHeight

        private static float getCellHeight(float width,
                                   PdfBox.Cell cell)
        Calculates the height of a cell that would be drawn in the specified width
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the cell rectangle
        cell - The cell data
        Returns:
        The minimum height that would fit the cell

      • createCellsOfProductTable

        private PdfBox.Cell[][] createCellsOfProductTable(java.lang.String[] tableTitles,
                                                  java.lang.String[] contentAlignments,
                                                  java.lang.String[] tableContents,
                                                  int tableTitleFontSize,
                                                  int tableContentFontSize,
                                                  org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont tableTitleFont,
                                                  org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFont tableContentFont,
                                                  java.awt.Color tableTitleTextColor,
                                                  java.awt.Color tableTitleBackColor,
                                                  java.awt.Color tableContentTextColor,
                                                  java.awt.Color tableContentBackColor)
        Creates a matrix of cells to create a table of two rows where the first one is for titles and the second one is for informations. All strings should be as long as the others. This method is auxiliary of drawProduct(SectionProduct)
        Parameters:
        tableTitles - Texts in the 1st row of the table
        contentAlignments - Alignment in each column of the 2nd row
        tableContents - Texts in each column of the 2nd row
        tableTitleFontSize - Font size in the 1st row
        tableContentFontSize - Font size in the 2nd row
        tableTitleFont - Font in the 1st row
        tableContentFont - Font in the 2nd row
        tableTitleTextColor - Color of the text in the 1st row
        tableTitleBackColor - Color of the rectangle in the 1st row
        tableContentTextColor - Color of the text in the 2nd row
        tableContentBackColor - Color of the rect. in the 2nd row
        Returns:
        The matrix of cells of two rows

      • drawSection

        private void drawSection(Section section)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a section in the last page or in a new one if there is no enough space to fit the title and its first product. A section consists of a title and a list of products. Draws the section below cursorPosition, and sets it at the bottom of the last product
        Parameters:
        section - The section to draw
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • drawTotal

        private void drawTotal()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a table listing all sections and their totals, and a final table with the total sum and taxes. Draws the tables below cursorPosition, and sets it below the last table. If the tables do not fit in the current page, will add new pages. This method is used in the summary of a Budget or Offer with a global total adding all its sections.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • drawSectionTotal

        private void drawSectionTotal(float x,
                              float y,
                              float width,
                              java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String netTotal,
                              java.lang.String taxes,
                              java.lang.String total)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a table of three rows and two columns showing the total price, taxes and total with taxes. The table is headed by a title. This method is used to draw totals in the case of each section if there is not a global total or the global total if all sections are added
        Parameters:
        x - Coordinate of the left side of the table
        y - Coordinate of the top side of the table
        width - The width of the table
        title - The title text of the table
        netTotal - The text as total before taxes
        taxes - The text as amount to add in taxes
        total - The text as total with taxes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getSectionTotalHeight

        private float getSectionTotalHeight(java.lang.String title,
                                    float width)
        Calculates the height of a table of three rows and two columns with the specified width, showing the total price, taxes and total with taxes. The table would be headed by a title, that is counted in the height. This method is used to ensure that the table fits in the page before drawing it
        Parameters:
        title - The title text of the table
        width - The width of the table
        Returns:
        The height of the table

      • drawSummary

        private void drawSummary()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Draws a summary containing the contact information of the client and the commercial. This method should be called after creating a new page. Sets cursorPosition after the last line
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • drawNote

        private void drawNote()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Draws the final note of the budget in the bottom of the current page or, if it does not fit, in the bottom of a new page. Uses cursorPosition to check whether it fits, and sets cursorPosition on the pageMarginBottom
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setColors

        private void setColors()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Sets textColor and bwColor attributes. Uses the colors of the top right quarter of the cover image, so it should be called after loading the budget with the cover. Sets bwColor Black or White depending on the color of the cover, and textColor with the same color as the cover, darkening it if it is too clear
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • mmToPdfBox

        protected static float mmToPdfBox(float mm)
        Converts the size in millimeters to the size in the PdfBox units. Should use an specific method for the paper size. Returns the input if the paper size is not implemented.
        Parameters:
        mm - Millimeters
        Returns:
        Length in PdfBox units

      • mmToPdfBoxA4

        private static float mmToPdfBoxA4(float mm)
        Converts the size in millimeters to the size in PdfBox units for a sheet of size A4 (297mm high).
        Parameters:
        mm - Millimeters
        Returns:
        Length un PdfBox units for an A4 sheet

      • formatMoney

        protected static java.lang.String formatMoney(float quantity)
        Converts a quantity into an string like 0,00 EUR
        Parameters:
        quantity - Money quantity
        Returns:
        String with the money quantity

      • formatNumber

        protected static java.lang.String formatNumber(float quantity)
        Converts a number to a String with 0, 1 or 2 decimal positions, such as: -0.11545 to -0,12 0.1000 to 0,1 2.00 to 2
        Parameters:
        quantity - The number
        Returns:
        String with the number

      • formatPercentage

        protected static java.lang.String formatPercentage(float quantity)
        Converts a number into a percentage format with two decimals such as: -0.11545 to -0,12% 0.1000 to 0,10% 2.00 to 2,00%
        Parameters:
        quantity -
        Returns:

      • mergeAttachments

        private void mergeAttachments()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Merges the attachments of the budget with the PDF, appending them at the end of the document
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
